question: You are a project manager in the IT industry. You have been asked to perform a cost benefit analysis for two proposed projects. Project A costs $2.4 million with potential benefits of $12 million and future operating costs of $3 million. Project B costs $2.8 million with potential benefits of $14 million and future operating costs of $2 million. Which project should you recommend?

options.A: Project A, as the cost to implement is cheaper than project B
options.B: Project A, as the potential benefits plus the future operating costs are less in value than the same calculation for Project B
options.C: Project B, as the potential benefits minus the implementation and future operating costs are greater in value than the same calculation for Project A
options.D: Project B, as the potential benefits minus the costs to implement are greater in value than the same calculation for Project A

explanation: Project B, as the potential benefits minus the implementation and future operating costs are greater in value than the same calculation for Project A. Project B's cost benefit analysis is $9.2 million benefit to the company compared to $6.6 million for Project A. Cost-benefit analysis takes into consideration the initial costs to implement and future operating costs.

question: Project A has an Internal Rate of Return (IRR) of 20%, Project B has an IRR of 12%, Project C has an IRR of 22%, and Project D has an IRR of 10%. Which of these would be the BEST project?
explanation: The higher the IRR, the greater the financial return. Since Project C has the highest IRR among the stated projects, Project C is the best.

question: The payback period needs to be calculated for your project that will be completed in 3 years. The internal rate of return (IRR) is 7% and the annual savings expected are $500K per year. The total cost of the project is $3,000K. What is the payback period?
explanation: The payback period states how soon the project can recover its investment. In this project, $3000/$500=6 years, which is the period for the project to recover its cost.

question: Risks can be divided into two basic types: business risk and pure or insurable risk. Of the following, which one falls under business risk?
explanation: Profit loss is always considered a business risk.

question: You discover that one of your team members is telling people that he is PMP certified. You thought he had not taken the test yet. What should you do?

options.A: Have him removed from the project
options.B: Talk to him in person and attempt to clarify the status
options.D: Tell other team members that he is not being honest about this

explanation: Talk to him in person and attempt to clarify the status. Option A should not be considered unless being a PMP certified professional is a prerequisite for the project. Ignoring the misrepresentation by your team member (option C) will be unethical. Telling other team members (option D) will negatively influence his image and will not resolve the issue.

question: Which of the following constitutes Juran's "quality trilogy"?
explanation: "Planning, improvement, control" constitute Juran's "quality trilogy."

question: There are two basic types of warranties. What warranty type relates to "merchantability" or "fitness for particular purpose"?
explanation: Implied represents merchantability or fitness for particular purpose.

question: The major type of standard warranty that is used in the business environment is:
explanation: The two types of warranties are express and implied. Express involves an actual promise specifically stated or expressed in a contract or an agreement. Implied means the terms of the warranty are created by the law regardless of the words of the parties in the contract or the agreement.

question: During negotiations, the seller tells you that he wants to work with you, but if he does not have a signed contract by the next day, he will not be able to obtain the equipment needed to meet your due date. In view of this, which of the following should you issue?
explanation: The "letter of intent" is an expression of intention and can be used to start the work.

question: You are the project manager for an IT project located in the UK, and your project team includes people from Australia, Netherlands, Singapore, and India. You are working on a software development project. When the project is 75 percent complete, your sponsor decides to close the project and move the team to a new project of strategic importance. Which type of closing does this refer to?
explanation: Integration implies that if a project is closed due to any reasons, then the activities stated in the closing process should be performed. In case of starvation (option A), a project is closed because resources are cut from the project and are no longer available for the project. In case of addition (option D), a project is closed because projects are evolved into ongoing operations. In case of Extinction (option B) project is completed and is accepted by the stakeholders.

question: Which type of leadership style is most appropriate when managing large numbers of low-skilled workers?
explanation: Autocratic is the right type of leadership style for managing large numbers of low skilled workers.

question: Which of the following is NOT true about affinity diagrams?

options.B: Helps to synthesize large amounts of data by finding relationships between ideas
options.C: Aids in solving a problem or analyzing a situation

explanation: Affinity diagrams are not Schedule Management tools. Affinity diagrams aid in solving a problem or analyzing a situation. They are also known as the KJ method after its developer Kawakita Jiro. An affinity diagram helps to synthesize large amounts of data by finding relationships between ideas. The information is then gradually structured from the bottom up into meaningful groups. This allows you to clearly "see" what you have, so you can begin your analysis or come to a decision.

question: Portfolio management is the responsibility of the senior management team of an organization or business unit. Which of the following is NOT a technique that is used to support the portfolio management process?
explanation: Of the following listed techniques, the grid technique is not used to support the portfolio management process.

question: According to the Utility Theory, what are the dimensions on the X and Y axis?

options.A: X-axis denotes money at stake and y-axis denotes utility
options.B: X-axis denotes utility and y-axis denotes money at stake
options.C: X-axis denotes performance and y-axis denotes money at stake
options.D: X-axis denotes money at stake and y-axis denotes performance

explanation: In the Utility Theory, the X-axis denotes money at stake and y-axis denotes utility.

question: Which statements are NOT true regarding the cash flow analysis technique?

options.A: The discounted cash flow technique compares cash inflows as a total, while NPV calculates cash inflows period by period and then totals the present value of each period
options.B: The discounted cash flow technique and the NPV technique both take the time value of money into consideration
options.C: NPV is the most conservative cash flow analysis technique and assumes reinvestment at the cost of capital
options.D: The discounted cash flow technique may use future value and present value formulas to determine the value of the investment or return. It's the least precise of all of the cash flow calculations

explanation: The discounted cash flow technique may use future value and present value formulas to determine the value of the investment or return. It is the least precise of all of the cash flow calculations.

question: Which of the following are addressed by the project managers?
explanation: The Project Managers address intermediate-range planning (1-5 years) and short-range/tactical planning (1 year or less). Since only intermediate range is provided as an option, B is the correct answer

question: Which of the following is NOT a measure of the profitability of a project or program?
explanation: Return on original investment, net present value, and discounted cash flow are measures of the profitability of a project or program. Depreciation is the loss of value of an asset due to its usage, so this is not a measure of the profitability of a project or program.

question: The swiftest and most effective communication occurs among people who have:

options.D: The ability to reduce perception barriers

explanation: Communication proves to be the swiftest and the most effective when people with common viewpoints communicate.

question: You are managing a healthcare project which requires compliance to certain FDA standards. This is part of the product acceptance criteria stated by the customer. You and your team have studied the requirements and have created a plan to implement the deliverables with the required level of quality. This process is called:
explanation: These activities are part of the Plan Quality Management process. It involves identifying the quality standards that are relevant to the project and determining how to meet them.

question: You are a project manager who is contemplating outsourcing a software development activity versus building it in-house. Which of the following factors would LEAST influence your decision to outsource?
explanation: This is an example of deriving answers through the process of elimination. All of the other factors are critical and should be considered during the make or buy analysis. Since this is a software development project, the physical location of the vendor is not critical.

question: Which of the following is the correct formula for calculating the present value of a business or organization? Note: R = interest rate, n = time periods
explanation: The correct formula for calculating present value is Present Value = Future Value/(1+R)^n

question: You are a project manager and in charge of a seminar and training session with approximately 2,000-2,500 employees attending. You have rented a hall for the seminar; however, you are unsure exactly how many people will attend. Moreover, the number of tables required will change depending on attendance. The cost of the furniture should be considered as:
explanation: This should be considered as variable cost as the cost will vary depending on the number of attendees.

question: Which of the following determines if a project idea is realistic?
explanation: Feasibility study determines if a project is realistic or not.

question: Which is the best way of selecting a project, when other things are being constant?
explanation: The criteria for selection with regard to NPV and BCR should be that projects with higher values should be selected, hence options C and D are ruled out. Compared to payback period, IRR is a more reliable measure since it considers time value of money, so A is a better option than B.

question: You are managing a construction project. You have to decide between renting a digger or buying it for the project. You would require the digger for 7 days of work and the following are the costs involved. Cost of digger is $1,400, daily cost of operation = $50, daily rental of the digger= $250. Which of the following is true?

options.A: It is more economical to buy the digger
options.B: It is more economical to take the digger on rent
options.D: Can't determine with the limited data

explanation: Both are equally economical. Buying option: Cost of digger+(7days*daily cost of operation)=$1400+(7*$50)=$1750. Renting the digger= 7days*daily rental=7*$250=$1750. So both are equal.

question: A Project Manager is working on constructing a new bridge, but is not getting enough project attention. Resources are occupied in process-related work and the Project Manager has little authority to assign resources. In what form of organization is the project being performed?
explanation: In a functional organization, team members are more concerned about their functional work than the project activities. In this case, the project is not getting enough attention because resources are occupied in process-related work, and the Project Manager does not have much authority to direct them to the project work.

question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a project?

options.A: It is composed of interrelated activities
options.D: It has a definite beginning and end

explanation: A project is a one-time endeavor with a definite start and end date. It is not generally repeated every week.

question: How is a project lifecycle different from a product lifecycle?

options.A: Project lifecycle talks about specific project management activities
options.B: Project lifecycle is different for different industries
options.D: Product lifecycle sees many products through their lifecycle

explanation: Option C is wrong as a product lifecycle sees many projects through their lifecycle. Option D is also wrong. A project management plan has various project activities.

question: A high-level project's schedule constraints have just been determined. Which phase is the project in?
explanation: The high level schedule constraints are determined during the initiating phase of the project. The detailed planning is done during the planning phase.

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of a projectized organization?
explanation: The other three options are advantages of a projectized organization. Since projectized organizations are organized by project, they are efficient in terms of project organization. Also, there is loyalty to the project, and communication during project is good. In a functional organization, team members work on projects in addition to their regular functional work, and they get confused about priorities.

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of a functional organization?

options.A: Project Manager has little or no authority
options.C: Team members report to a single "Boss"
options.D: Clearly defined career path in area of specialization

explanation: The other options are advantages of a functional organization. To know more about functional organizations, please refer to Lesson no. 2 of Simplilearn PMP® Preparation Course.

question: How is operational work different from project work?

options.A: Operational work has a unique product or service as output
options.B: Operational work is ongoing, whereas project work is a one-time endeavor
options.C: Operational work is a one-time endeavor, whereas project work is ongoing

explanation: Projects are created with some objectives and have a definite start and end date. They are one-time activities. An operation is ongoing work. An example of operational work is manufacturing of standard products.

question: What is the most powerful role in a projectized organization?
explanation: A projectized organization is organized by projects, so the Project Manager has the maximum power in this type of organization.

question: Which of the following is a source of information about specific project constraints and assumptions based on the current environment, historical record, and expert judgment?
explanation: Project constraints, assumptions, and high level risks are listed in the project charter based on the current environment, historical data, and/or expert judgment. This will help the project manager identify the project limitations and propose an implementation approach. The project scope management plan details how the project scope will be managed, such as how changes to the project scope will be dealt with.

question: What is the main purpose of the project charter?

options.A: It contains the initial scope of work
options.B: It contains the list of risks that need to be addressed
options.C: It authorizes the Project Manager to use organization resources to execute the project
options.D: It identifies the project sponsor who will pay for the project

explanation: It gives the Project Manager the authority to spend money and commit corporate resources to the project. In most project situations, the project team does not report to the Project Manager in the corporate structure. This reporting structure can lead to cooperation and performance issues. The project charter helps resolve these issues.

question: A Project Manager is assigned to a new critical project, but the project charter itself is undergoing multiple changes. Whose primary responsibility is it to decide whether the changes to the project charter are required or not?
explanation: A project charter should be created by the Project Sponsor and handed over to the Project Manager. The Project Manager can provide his inputs while the project charter is being prepared. It's the project sponsor's responsibility to avoid any unnecessary changes to the project charter.

question: What is the key role of a Project Sponsor in a project?

options.A: Helps in identifying key project risks
options.B: Helps in preventing unnecessary changes to the project objectives
options.C: Helps in identifying some key project activities
options.D: Shares lessons learnt from the previous project

explanation: Even though the sponsor may help to identify some key risks and share lessons learned from previous projects, the sponsor's role is to ensure that there are no unnecessary changes made to the project objectives.

question: As a Project Manager, you present your cost estimate to the Project Sponsor. The sponsor asks you to cut the cost by 10%. What should you do?

options.A: Replace the originally planned resources with new resources at lower rates
options.B: Strongly say "No" to the Sponsor and walk out of the project
options.C: Ask all team members to reduce the cost of their activities by 10%
options.D: Cut some of the project activities and inform the Sponsor

explanation: Play with triple constraint by cutting down the scope of work and obtain sponsor approval.

question: During which project management process group is a rough order of magnitude estimate created?
explanation: A rough order of magnitude estimate refers to a very high-level estimate. This is generally done during the project initiation phase when very limited information is available about the project.

question: Which process group recognizes that a project or phase should begin and commits this to the organization?
explanation: Initiating process group recognizes that the project or phase should begin and commits this to the organization.

question: Which of the following is NOT an advantage of obtaining approval for the project charter from the sponsor and the customer?

options.A: Preparation of the project plan is done during this period
options.B: The project charter ensures commitment and acceptance of the sponsor and the customer
options.C: The project charter declares the Project Manager
options.D: The project charter formalizes the authority assigned to the Project Manager

explanation: When the project charter is approved by the sponsor and/or customer, the Project Manager is formally authorized to manage the project. It indicates that the project will have the support of the sponsor and customer and that the project will gain commitment and acceptance from them. Options B, C, and D are all advantages.

question: In a multi-phased project, when should the initiating processes be invoked?

options.A: In the middle of each phase
options.B: At the end of each phase
options.D: At the start of each phase

explanation: In a multi-phased project, invoking the initiating processes at the start of each phase helps to keep the project focused on the business need for which the project was created.

question: Which of the following is an input to the "identify stakeholders" process?
explanation: Of the stated options, "Procurement documents" is an input to the "Identify Stakeholders" process. Stakeholder register and Stakeholder Management Strategy are outputs from the "Identify Stakeholders" process. Expert judgment is a tool and technique for this process. For more information on this process, refer to Page No : 507 of PMBOK® Guide - Sixth Edition.

question: Multiple classification models are available to prioritize the key stakeholders and to ensure efficient use of effort to communicate and manage their expectations. One such model is the Salience Model. Which of the following parameters is NOT considered by this model?
explanation: The Salience Model is a multiple classification model that describes classes of stakeholders based on their power, urgency, and legitimacy. Influence is a key parameter used in the Power/Influence grid and Influence/Impact grid. For more information on this process, refer to Page No: 513 of PMBOK® Guide - Sixth Edition.

question: Which of the following is NOT an input to "develop project charter"?
explanation: Expert judgment is a technique, and not an input.

question: Which of the following is NOT an element of the project charter?

options.A: The product description or a reference to this document
options.B: The business need that the project was undertaken to address
options.D: The formal authorization to apply organizational resources to project activities

explanation: Of all the options listed, Option C, work package descriptions, is not an element of the project charter. It is an element of the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).

question: Which technique is used in the "identify stakeholders" process?
explanation: Expert Judgment is a  technique used in the "Identify stakeholders" process. Option D, Procurement of documents, is the input to this process. Options B and C, stakeholder management strategy and stakeholder register, are the outputs from this process. For more information on this process, refer to Page No. 507 of PMBOK® Guide - Sixth Edition

question: Which statements describe the relationship between the project phases and the project lifecycle?

options.A: The project lifecycle contains the iterative incremental elements of a project phase
options.B: The project lifecycle contains the repetitive elements of a project phase
options.C: The project lifecycle is regarded as a sequence of project activities, while phases are defined to control the overlapping of activities
options.D: Collectively, the project phases are known as the project lifecycle

explanation: Phases are divisions within a project where extra control is needed to effectively manage the completion of a major project deliverable. The high-level nature of project phases makes them an element of the project lifecycle. For more information, please refer to PMBOK® Guide - Sixth Edition Page No. 547.

question: Who does the project team report to in a projectized organization?

options.A: The project team does not report to anybody

explanation: Project teams report to Project Manager in a projectized organization.

question: In a matrix organization, a Project Manager can expect the communication to be:
explanation: Communication in a matrix organization is complex because each team member has two bosses, a functional manager and a Project Manager.

question: During a regular project meeting, one of the team members suggests a nice feature that the customer may like. The Project Manager says "no" to this feature as the project should concentrate only on what is required for completion. This is an example of:
explanation: One of the key responsibilities of a Project Manager is to ensure that only what is in the project scope is done. Doing more than what is part of the project scope is called gold plating, and PMI® is against gold plating.

question: A Project Manager asks you about the software to be used to create the WBS and is concerned about the graphical representation of the WBS. As an experienced Project Manager, you suggest that the key result of creating a WBS is not the graphical representation but:
explanation: A WBS should be created with the project team, and all of the team members should have confidence that only the work required to complete the project is captured in the WBS. A WBS is not just a graphical representation. It should be used as a tool for team communication so that everybody knows what they are supposed to do and also what other team members are supposed to work on.

question: Which of the following is NOT true regarding subdividing the work in the WBS?

options.A: Subdivide until it has a meaningful conclusion
options.B: Subdivide until it can be done by a single person
options.C: Subdivide until it cannot be logically subdivided further
options.D: Subdivide until it can be accurately estimated

explanation: Options (a), (c), and (d) are important properties to be considered while creating a WBS.

question: As a Project Manager, what can you use to clearly communicate the work that is included in the work packages?
explanation: The WBS dictionary has the detailed work description of all the work packages.

question: Brad is the Project Manager of a new data migration project. He is supposed to release his project WBS. In order to create his WBS, Brad goes to the organization process database and looks at the WBS of a completed data migration project. He uses that as a starting point to create his own WBS. Which of the following tools and techniques of creating WBS process is he using?
explanation: Brad is using the technique of Decomposition.

question: Product analysis is done during the development of:
explanation: For projects that have a product as a deliverable, as opposed to a service or a result, product analysis is an effective tool.

question: A Project Manager has received activity duration estimates from his team. Which of the following does he need in order to complete the schedule development?
explanation: Once the team members give their estimate, a good Project Manager should add some Reserves. This is also called padding the estimate. Should you need more clarification on this, refer to Lesson no. 6 (Project Schedule Management) of Simplilearn PMP® Preparation Course.

question: A Project Manager is calculating the weighted average of activity duration estimates to do the schedule network analysis. Which schedule network analysis technique is the Project Manager using?
explanation: In the PERT technique, three estimates (Optimistic, Pessimistic and Most Likely) of each activity duration are calculated and then a weighted average of each duration estimate is arrived at. In order to get more details about PERT, please refer to Lesson no. 6 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation course.

question: An activity has an Early Start (ES) on day 5 and Late Start (LS) on day 10, an Early Finish (EF) on day 20 and Late Finish (LF) on day 25. What can be said about this activity?

options.A: The activity is not progressing at all
options.B: The activity is not on a critical path
options.C: Not enough information to tell anything about the activity
options.D: The activity is on critical path

explanation: The formula to calculate float is LS-ES or LF-EF. This activity has a float of 5 days. Generally, if an activity has float, it is not on the critical path. Since there is no other information provided, Option B is the best answer. There is absolutely no information about the activity progress, so nothing can be said about Option D.

question: After completing the schedule network analysis, you find out that your project schedule is taking too long and you also find that you cannot change your network diagram. In such cases, in order to get the project completed faster, what option do you have?
explanation: There are two ways to do schedule compression: fast tracking and crashing. As the question clearly says that the network diagram cannot change, fast tracking is not possible, and you can solve the problem only by crashing the project. Also, resource leveling is not a schedule compression technique. In order to get more information on the schedule network analysis technique, please refer to Lesson no. 6 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: Your Program Manager asks you to reduce the project duration. You look at the network diagram and start identifying the activities that can possibly happen in parallel. Which technique are you using?
explanation: Fast tracking is the process of replacing the serial relationship of activities with a parallel relationship in order to reduce the project duration. This is one of the schedule network analysis techniques. You can learn more about the other schedule network analysis techniques by referring to Lesson no. 6 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: Which of the following project management tools is best suited to calculate the maximum time that a project will take to be completed?
explanation: The other 3 options will not give information about the critical path, and without critical path information we will not be able to calculate the longest time period for a project.

question: What is the duration of a milestone?

options.A: Average of the activity before and after the milestone

explanation: A milestone is defined as an activity with zero duration. Milestones are used on the project schedule to show completion of a set of activities and for reporting purposes. For example, all requirements-related activities can be grouped, and once all of them are completed, you can say that the requirement milestone has been achieved.

question: As a Project Manager, you are asking each of your team members to give time estimates of their activities and calendar dates when they are available to work on those activities. What exactly are you doing?
explanation: Schedule development is the process of assigning calendar dates of when each activity will be done and by whom. This is exactly what the Project Manager is doing. You can find out more about each of the project time management processes by referring to Lesson 6 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: You have been assigned as the Project Manager of a development project. The WBS has been completed and the activity sequencing has also been done. The activity duration estimate has also been received by each of the team members. What should be the next step in the project?

options.A: Get cost estimate of each activity

explanation: The question mentions that activities have been identified and sequenced. The duration estimate has also been received. Before going ahead and finalizing the schedule, you should look at compressing the schedule to optimize it. Option C is related to the WBS, and that's done before activities are sequenced. Option D is done once the schedule is finalized.

question: In one of your projects, a team member, John, informs you that he works on user interface development, which is a very creative activity. He cannot estimate the time required to complete the activity. However, as a Project Manager, you need the activity's estimates. You decide to use the past data, i.e., the number of hours spent by him and the number of user interfaces designed by him in those hours. Which estimation technique are you using?
explanation: Parametric estimation is the technique of using a parameter to generate estimates. In this case, the Project Manager is using the parameter of the number of interfaces produced per hour to do the estimation. In order to know more about project estimation techniques like analogous estimation, please refer to Lesson 6 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: Rearranging resources so that the same number of resources work on the project each month is also called:
explanation: Since you are making sure that the same number of resources work on the project each month, you are doing resource leveling.

question: A Project Manager is allocating the overall cost estimates to individual activities to establish a baseline for measuring project performance. What process is the Project Manager performing?
explanation: Please go through Lesson 7 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course for clarity on Project Cost Management.

question: A Project Manager is defining the contract, terms and conditions, and negotiations with vendors. Which of the following techniques is the Project Manager working on?
explanation:
Contract management involves defining the contract, terms and conditions, and negotiations with vendors. Vendor management involves selecting the best sellers according to the source selection criteria. Contract types and selection criteria deal with selection of different types of contracts, like fixed price, cost reimbursable, time and material, etc. This will be applicable if outsourcing is done. Selection criteria are developed and used to rate or score seller proposals and can be objective or subjective. 
Configuration management is a collection of procedures used to track project artifacts and monitor and control project artifacts. These techniques have been newly added to the examination content outline.

question: As a Project Manager, what would you give the highest priority: quality, cost, or schedule?

options.A: Completing the project according to schedule is most important
options.B: Quality is of utmost important. Cost and Schedule come later
options.C: It would depend upon the project
options.D: Cost is most important. Everything else can be compromised.

explanation: Quality, cost, and schedule are all part of triple constraints, so they are equally important.

question: A Project Manager is considering  regulatory requirements such as government and industry standards, weather conditions, infrastructure, and economic factors that may impact the project outcome. Which of the following techniques is being used?
explanation: Regulatory and environmental impact assessment considers regulatory requirements like government and industry standards, weather conditions, infrastructure, and economic factors that may impact the project outcome. Organizational and operational awareness is situational awareness based on organizational practices. Situational awareness is understanding what is happening around you with reference to different parameters. Risk assessment technique involves identifying the risk, understanding qualitative and quantitative analysis, and choosing different risk responses. These techniques have been newly added to the examination content outline.

question: You are the Project Manager of an ongoing project involving 50 employees of your company and 10 subcontractors. You want to know who is assigned to what task. Where should you look for this information?
explanation: Who is assigned to work on what is listed in the responsibility assignment matrix.

question: Your organization wants to build a new web-based HR management system. You are the Project Manager from the IT team, and the HR manager of the organization is expected to assign two of his team members to work on this project as functional experts. However, the HR manager assigns team members who do not have a good reputation for being knowledgeable. As a Project Manager, what should you do?

options.A: Meet the HR manager's boss and explain your concerns to him/her
options.B: Schedule a meeting with the HR manager and ask why he assigned those members to this project and share your concern regarding their competence
options.C: Escalate the issue to the IT head
options.D: Try to find out who the good HR team members are and request them to be a part of your project

explanation: The best way to deal with this is to first meet the concerned person and convey your viewpoint. Only if there is no satisfactory action should you look at escalating the matter.

question: Which of the following documents has information regarding how people should be informed about the project's progress?
explanation: Communication Management plan has information regarding how people should be informed about the project's progress.

question: Which of the following is NOT a technique to plan communication in the project?
explanation: The communication management plan is an output of the "plan communication" process. In order to find out more about the project communication management knowledge area, please refer to Lesson 10 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: A project has 10 team members spread across 4 different countries. How many channels of communication exist?
explanation: The formula to calculate the number of channels is (n*(n-1)/2), where n stands for the number of team members on the project.

question: You have been assigned as the Project Manager of a new e-business project. There appear to be many risks involved in the project, but nobody has evaluated them to assess the range of possible outcomes. What was not done?
explanation: This can include qualitative or quantitative risk analysis.

question: During risk response planning, you identified a few new risks. What should you do?

options.A: Document the risks and let the contingency reserve take care of them
options.B: Ask to increase the contingency reserve to take care of these new risks
options.D: Follow the risk management processes of calculating risk probability and impact

explanation: When new risks are identified, you should follow the risk management processes. The next step is to analyze the probability and impact of the risks.

question: Plan risk response focuses on:

options.A: Identifying a comprehensive list of risks for the project
options.C: Creating strategies to deal with the risks in a project

explanation: A Plan risk response generates a plan that the Project Manager will use to deal with the risks.

question: Tom is the Project Manager of a software project whose client is based in Brazil. The team is in the planning stage and is performing the processes of risk management. Tom has come to you for assistance in handling the response to identified and prioritized negative risks. Which of the following is not a strategy for handling negative risk?
explanation: Risks can be broadly classified into two categories: positive risks that have a positive impact on the project and negative risks that have a negative impact on the project. In this case, the first three options are strategies to deal with negative risks. Option D is a strategy to deal with positive risks. If the risks have positive impact on the project, then enhance their impact.

question: Which of the following is a key characteristic of the Delphi technique?

options.B: Using Analogous approach to solve problems
options.C: Using Parametric approach to solve problems

explanation: The Delphi technique is based on the philosophy of building consensus with experts.

question: As a Project Manager, you have been asked to assist the contract manager in drafting the contract of a large project with limited scope clarity. What type of contract would you suggest, so that your organization does not face any financial losses?
explanation: Please note that a time and material contract is best suited for smaller projects. In order to get more information about the different types of contracts, (i.e. Time and Material, Cost plus Fixed Fee, etc.) refer to Lesson 12 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: Which of the following is not a technique to plan procurements?
explanation: A bidder conference is a technique to conduct procurements. The other three are techniques to plan procurements.

question: Henry is a contract manager and is in the process of signing a contract with a vendor for the installation of computer servers. He is aware of the entire scope of work. Which contract type would he sign with the vendor?

options.D: Cost Plus a Percentage of the Cost

explanation: Since the scope of the work is clear, Henry should go for a fixed price contract. In order to know more about different types of contracts, you may refer to Lesson 12 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: You are the Project Manager of a project that involves the launch a new model of a car. The car has to hit the market before the festival season. However, you received information that the workers are planning to go on a strike at the same time. You try to come up with a strategy to get the new model of the car launched despite the  strike. This is an example of:
explanation: The Project Manager knew about the workers' strike (the risk) and looked for a workaround. This is an example of accepting the risk and finding alternative options.

question: You are using a large number of subcontractors on your project. When you inspect the attendance register, you notice a lot of irregularities in time-in and time-out. Your project is within cost and time budgets, and your team leads claim that such irregularities would not impact the project. However, you see this as a potential risk. Where do you record this?
explanation: Potential problems that have not yet become risks are listed on the watch list. The watch list is regularly monitored to ensure that if any of the listed issues become risks, they are handled using the project risk management processes.

question: Which of the following is NOT a cost estimation tool or technique?
explanation: Cost Aggregation is a cost budgeting tool. The other three options are cost estimation tools.

question: The project scope baseline consists of:

options.A: The scope management plan, the scope statement, and the WBS dictionary
options.B: The scope statement, the WBS, and the WBS dictionary
options.C: The scope management plan, the WBS, and the WBS dictionary
options.D: The scope management plan, the scope statement, and the WBS

explanation: Please refer to Lesson 5 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course for details.

question: Rob works for a consulting company that regularly acquires project teams for new assignments. Once the assignment is over, the team is dissolved. What kind of organization is Rob working for?
explanation: In order to find out more about the different types of project organizations, please refer to Lesson  2 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation course.

question: You were conducting the project post-mortem meeting for one of your recently completed projects. It was clear in the meeting that some of the customers were not fully satisfied with the project outcome. Your sponsor specifically asks you about the measures taken to ensure customer satisfaction. Which of your subsidiary plans would you refer him to?
explanation: One of the aims of planning quality in the project is to ensure that the project meets all of the stated requirements of the customer. If all the customer requirements are met, there is no reason why the customer should not be happy. However, if the customer is still unhappy, the reason needs to be further investigated.

question: You have just started a new project as a Project Manager. A couple of stakeholders with whom you have worked in the past come to you raising concerns about the utility of the new project management package being used and the way project changes would be logged. What should you do?

options.A: Assure the stakeholders that you will keep them engaged in the Project and that the new software will not in any way impact their functioning
options.B: Since they are friends, conduct an informal training session
options.C: Inform the Project Management Office about the stakeholders' concerns
options.D: Supply with training material on the new Project Management Software

explanation: Inform the Project Manager Office; they control the project management procedures and tools. In directing stakeholders to the PMO, the Project Manager is referring them to the right authority.

question: John was assigned to a new software development project. At the end of a change control board meeting, the Project Manager asks John to complete the paperwork required to make the changes. Jon's position can be BEST described as:
explanation: This position is typically found in weak matrix organizations. Project expeditors do not have any authority, but they typically work as staff assistants to the Project Manager. If you look at the question carefully, John is assisting the Project Manager in doing the required paperwork. In order to get more information about matrix organizations, please refer to Lesson 2 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: With respect to change, what is the most important activity for a Project Manager to focus on?

options.A: Inform Project Sponsor about the change

explanation: If you think that option D, "Implement the change," could also be the right answer, please note that the changes are actually done by the project team and not by the Project Manager.

question: In the middle of a project, you are informed that the resources promised at the beginning of the project are no longer available. What would you do?

options.A: Assert that you can no longer execute the project
options.B: Re-plan the project without promised resources
options.C: Identify other resources that can be provided to you in compensation for earlier promised resources
options.D: Evaluate the impact of not having the promised resources

explanation: The right thing to do in this case is to first evaluate the impact.

question: A customer is well known for making a lot of changes to an ongoing project. You have been assigned as the Project Manager for a new project from this customer. What would you do in the beginning of the project to manage this customer?

options.A: Send a copy of your company change control procedure
options.B: Involve the customer as early as possible on the project
options.C: Strictly say "No" to the customer a few times
options.D: Inform your manager about the customer's past record

explanation: The best way to handle this scenario is to involve the customer as early in the project as possible. Many stakeholders may create problems because of ignorance, so involving them early in the project makes them aware of the project benefits.

question: As a Project Manager, you received a change that does not impact the project schedule. What would you do?

options.B: Evaluate the impact on other components of the triple constraint
options.C: Get in touch with the Change control board
options.D: Go ahead and accept the change

explanation: Whenever there is a change, impact on all of the triple constraint factors should be evaluated.

question: You have been assigned as the Project Manager of a project that is halfway through execution. You meet the customer and inform him that the project is within the time and budget estimates; however, the customer informs you that he is not happy with the performance of the project. What should you do first?

options.A: Show the customer the performance of other similar projects
options.B: Meet the Project Sponsor and explain the customer's concerns
options.C: Inform the customer that there are no shortcomings from the project team
options.D: Meet with the project team to understand what can be done

explanation: The answer depends upon the scenario. If you heard that the customer is unhappy from someone else, the best thing would be to meet the customer. In this case, the customer is letting you know that he is not happy. The best option is to meet with the project team and discuss the customer's concerns before doing anything else.

question: The customer has asked you to get the project completed one week ahead of schedule. What is the best thing for you to do?

options.D: Advise the customer about the impact of the change

explanation: The other options are used to reduce the project schedule, but the first thing to do is understand the impact of the change.

question: Which of the following is the BEST thing to do to complete a project three weeks ahead of schedule?

options.A: Inform the customer that the critical path does not allow early completion
options.B: Motivate the team to work hard and look for the status update the following month
options.C: Meet the team and look for options for crashing or fast tracking the critical path

explanation: It is always important to understand what best can be done before going ahead with any other tasks.

question: During the project execution, a large number of changes are made to the project. The Project Manager should:

options.A: Wait for all the changes to happen and print a new schedule
options.B: Make only the changes approved by the management
options.C: Talk to management before any changes are made
options.D: Make the approved changes and retain the schedule baseline

explanation: Make the approved changes and retain the schedule baseline. It's not bad to have changes, but changes must be managed and the baseline should be maintained.

question: You have recently joined a new organization where there are many problems with project management. Projects are not completed on time. You have been assigned to help the senior management of the organization to understand these problems. Which of the following reports should you create?
explanation: A milestone report has summary details about the project. Detailed Cost Estimate is not relevant to the question because the current problem that the senior management is facing is with projects not being completed on time. A Gantt Chart is created to communicate the project's schedule with the team.

question: Which of the following is an example of quality assurance?
explanation: Audit and process analysis are key quality assurance tools. If you need further explanation on what comes under quality assurance and what comes under quality control, you should go through Lesson 8 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: You are currently working as a Project Manager of a major software project that is facing severe time pressures. The quality department informs you that they have to perform a quality audit of the project. The team members are not cooperating. As a Project Manager, how do you explain to them the purpose of the quality audit?

options.A: The audit checks if the customer is aware of the project process
options.B: An audit is a management decision and must be performed
options.C: The purpose of the audit is to check if the project is following any ineffective or inefficient policies
options.D: The purpose of the audit is to check the time sheet of all team members

explanation: A quality audit is a structured, independent review to determine whether project activities comply with the organizational and project policies, processes, and procedures. For more information, refer the PMBOK® Guide - Sixth Edition Page 294.

question: Chris is the Project Manager of a new software development project. He finds a major issue with the project requirement management process, and can find a trend of requirement-related defects. He is using an Ishikawa diagram to come up with the root cause of the trend and to make recommendations to avoid problems in the future. What process is he implementing?
explanation: Process analysis is one of the tools to perform quality assurance. In order to find out more about process analysis, please refer to Lesson 8 of Simplilearn PMP preparation course.

question: A team member is not performing well on a project because of inexperience. There is nobody who is better qualified to do the job. As a Project Manager, what should you do?

options.A: Arrange training for the team member
options.B: Escalate the matter to higher authority
options.C: Try doing it on your own
options.D: Wait till the team member fails to deliver

explanation: Arrange training for the team member.

question: Which of the following is the highest point in Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs?
explanation: You are expected to know about Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs. In order to find out more about Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs, refer to Lesson 9 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: Understanding and managing the team when the team is spread across different locations, time zones, and shifts is called______
explanation: Virtual/remote team management refers to understanding and managing the team when the team is spread across different locations, time zones, and shifts. Peer-review process is the review by people who are at the same level of expertise. Delegation involves assigning an activity to another person. Interpersonal skill is the ability to establish and maintain relationships with other people. These techniques are newly added in the examination content outline.

question: Which of the following is NOT a power derived from the Project Manager's authority?
explanation: If someone is assigned as a Project Manager, he or she gets formal power along with the power to reward or penalize. Expert power comes from experience or education. If you are recognized as an expert, people will count on your opinion and are more likely to follow your leadership.

question: Which of the following is NOT a way of avoiding conflict?

options.A: Asking two team members to work on the same activity
options.B: Keeping the team informed of the exact project status
options.C: Clearly assigning work with no overlapping responsibilities
options.D: Continuously motivating the team to help them face work challenges

explanation: Assigning overlapping responsibilities is sure to lead to conflict. One of the good ways to avoid conflict is to ensure that such things are avoided as much as possible. In order to know more about conflict resolution, you need to go through Lesson 9 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: As a Project Manager, you have a problem with a team member's performance. Which of the following is the best way of communicating this problem to the team member?
explanation: If this does not solve the problem, then you should go for formal written communication. In order to find out more about various ways of project communication, you may refer to Lesson 10 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: You have a team spread across five countries. What is the best communication method to follow?
explanation: Communication is a big issue. If the team members are geographically distributed, it's a good practice to use formal written communication. Project Managers should spend 90% of their time in communication.

question: You were asked to sit as an observer on another project's status review meeting. You observed that everyone present in the meeting was talking at the same time about different issues. The whole meeting was chaotic. What do you think was not done?

options.A: There were cultural issues as people of different backgrounds were attending the meeting
options.B: The right people were not invited for the meeting
options.C: The meeting agenda and ground rules were not set

explanation: The meeting agenda and ground rules need to be set for all meetings to avoid situations like the one mentioned in this question.

question: John is a new Project Manager who has joined an existing powerhouse project midway through project execution. He wants to understand the use of creating a "lessons learned" database. What would you tell him?

options.A: This should be done is order to be formally relieved from the Project
options.B: It serves as historical record for future projects
options.C: This should be done as it's a company policy
options.D: The Project Manager can show this as his accomplishment

explanation: The "lessons learned" database serves as a historical record for future projects.

question: You are executing a project for an overseas customer. There are multiple stakeholders at the customer's end; however, your point of contact has not introduced you to the manager who is supposed to run an event at the customer's end and may have some requirements for your project. If you do address his requirement, he might ask for a change in the project. There is also a possibility that the change control board will approve the change. What should you do?

options.A: Nothing, as your customer contact point has not formally introduced you to this stakeholder
options.B: Schedule a meeting with this stakeholder to understand his requirements
options.C: Add this issue as a potential project risk and address it at the appropriate time
options.D: Call your boss for guidance on this matter

explanation: The questions says that there is a stakeholder who has a requirement for your project, and it's most likely going to be approved by the change control board. As a proactive Project Manager, you should take the initiative to meet the customer and understand his requirement. If you do not meet the customer, you will not be proactively addressing the potential issues.

question: You are the Project Manager of a project that has just closed a contract with one of the suppliers. You need to communicate the status of the contract to your stakeholders. What kind of communication method would you use for this communication?
explanation: Any contractual matter has long-term implications, so well-documented and formal written communication is best suited for this purpose.

question: You have been sending project status reports to your customer every Monday morning. The project status report is an example of:
explanation: Status reports are shared with various stakeholders. Status reports are ideal for highlighting key project issues on a regular basis. They are an example of formal written communication. They also help in maintaining a communication record for future reference.

question: You are executing a project. The customer asks for a change that's going to increase the schedule risk. What should you do first?

options.A: Inform your manager about the customer's request
options.B: Inform the customer that the project would get delayed
options.C: Analyze the impact of the change with your team
options.D: Go ahead and accept the change

explanation: This is the first thing that you should do. Unless you know the impact, you will not be sure about what to communicate to either your manager or the customer.

question: You are the Project Manager of an engineering project that is about to close. The customer asks for a major change. What would you do in this scenario?

options.A: Discuss with the team to figure out the impact of the change
options.B: Refuse the change request and proceed with closure
options.C: Go ahead and accept the change
options.D: Discuss the situation with your senior management

explanation: The project is nearly complete (about to close), and the impact of the change is known to be major. Therefore, you need to get direction from your management before responding to the customer.

question: You have to fast track your project to meet the schedule deadline, so you decide to use your current software development vendor to develop the e-learning content instead of going through the process of issuing the RFP and looking for the right vendor. What is the main concern in this scenario?

options.B: Too much dependence on the same vendor
options.D: Violation of the organization's code of conduct

explanation: The software solution vendor might not be the right vendor to work on e-learning content.

question: A customer asked you to work on a contract scope of work for 6 months and come back to him when the work has been completed. As a Project Manager of the vendor organization, what should you do?

options.A: Complete the work and also keep a written record that the customer has asked you not to contact him
options.B: Ask your senior management to check if the customer is genuine
options.C: Meet the customer at the end of six months with deliverables
options.D: Complete the work as requested, but keep verifying the scope with the customer

explanation: Although the customer has requested not to be contacted, you should keep verifying what you are doing to ensure there is no gap in understanding the requirements.

question: You are in the process of selecting the seller for a part of your project that needs to be subcontracted. The project is being performed under a tight budget, and your senior management has given you strict instructions to select the lowest bidder. You have narrowed down to two bids. The lowest bid was from a bidder that you had a bad experience with in the past. The other bidder is very well known for treating customers well. Whom will you select?

options.B: Ask the other bidder to match the lowest  price
options.C: Disqualify the lowest bidder by citing some clause
options.D: Select the other bidder as you will have a nice time working with them

explanation: Once the rules for selecting the right vendor are communicated to you by the senior management, you should follow them. In this case, the senior management has clearly communicated that the lowest bidder must be selected.

question: You are executing a project in a foreign country where it's customary to pay the police for additional security cover. In another country, this might be considered bribery. You and your team members require the additional cover. What would you do?

options.A: Do not pay to the police as it is bribe
options.B: Pay the police because it's the local custom and cannot be classified as bribe
options.C: Ask for direction from your senior management
options.D: Find out if there is any budget for such payment and act accordingly

explanation: It's very important to understand the difference between what is a government fee and what is a bribe. As a certified PMP, you should say no to a bribe, but not to government fees. In this case, it is customary to pay for additional security, so you should go ahead and pay.

question: Which of the following is NOT true about a contract?

options.B: A contract is a legally binding document
options.C: A contract must be in writing
options.D: Changes to a contract can be done by the buyer without consulting the seller

explanation: The first three options are key characteristics of the contract. Once a contract is signed, any changes to be made in the contract must be agreed upon between the buyer and the seller in writing, so that it can be legally binding.

question: During which procurement process is contract negotiation done?
explanation: Contract negotiation to select the seller is done as a part of the conduct procurements process. In order to find out more about the procurement management processes, you may like to go through lesson 12 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: You were about to send a deliverable to your customer when you realize that there is a defect that the customer would not notice. What would you do?

options.B: Go ahead and send the deliverable
options.C: Inform your senior management and seek guidance

explanation: It's ethically not right to send a deliverable with a known defect to the customer. In the present case, the best thing is to speak with the customer to see if he is ok with you sending the deliverable with the defect.

question: You are sent by your company to execute a project in a foreign country. All of your equipment is detained at the airport, and the airport authority asks for a fee to release the equipment. You are also losing time on your project. What would you do?

options.A: Don't pay as it's a bribe
options.B: Pay and get the money from management reserve
options.C: Establish whether such payment is legal in that company
options.D: Ask your boss for the next step

explanation: Before jumping the gun, establish whether the airport is asking for a fee or a bribe. If it's a bribe, don't pay. If it's an airport usage fee, go ahead and pay.

question: You were competing with another colleague to become the Project Manager of a prestigious new project in the organization. Unfortunately, your colleague got the assignment. At a later date, your colleague comes to you for a document. What would you do?

options.A: Don't give him the document. Create a problem for him
options.B: Just avoid him and let him keep coming to you
options.C: Give him the document and also cooperate with him as much as possible
options.D: Tell him that the document is not useful and that you have lost  it

explanation: Once your colleague has been selected as the Project Manager, you should cooperate with him as much as possible.

question: You are the Project Manager of a new complex software development project. Your team is facing major issues with software design. One of your team members, Susan, says that her friend, who is working in another company, uses a third party software for designing similar projects and that the software helped them to reduce their project timeline by at least 20%. You are running short of time and want to do everything you can to get the project back on track; however, your project does not have the budget to buy any third party software. Your team member says she can get a copy of the software from a friend and use it on the project. As a Project Manager, what would you do?

options.A: Use a ready-made software to speed up the Project
options.B: Ask Susan to use the software and not tell anyone about it
options.C: Inform the team member about copyright policies and strictly tell her that the project cannot use unlicensed software
options.D: Accept the fact that your project is delayed and look for other ways to speed up the project

explanation: As a certified Project Manager, you are supposed to respect copyright laws and should not use unlicensed copies even if the project gets delayed.

question: You are the Project Manager of a large system integration project, and you are looking for a subcontractor to do certain aspects of the work. Your boss comes up with a recommendation for a vendor who has worked on many successful projects with your company. What should be your primary concern in such a scenario?

options.A: Does working with this vendor violate any of the company laws?
options.B: Is the vendor costlier than other vendors?
options.C: Is the vendor qualified to do such Work?

explanation: Whenever you have to subcontract any work to any vendor and you get a recommendation, the first thing you should do is to ensure that no applicable company or government rules are violated. Violating such rules is unethical, and a certified Project Manager is not expected to violate any rules.

question: You are working on a crucial project. You realize that you may miss the due date of the project. What do you do?

options.B: Evaluate options to meet the due date
options.C: Ask your manager for guidance in such cases
options.D: Remove the due date discussion in all stakeholder communication

explanation: When you know that you are going to miss the due date, the right thing to do is to look at options to meet the due date. Only when you cannot find any options should you change the due date and inform all of the stakeholders. It is unethical to not to communicate the due date.

question: One of your team members is not cooperative, and he has a reputation of getting into frequent problems with other team members. What should you do to handle this team member?

options.A: Escalate the issue to your Senior Manager
options.C: Warn this team member a couple of times strictly
options.D: Address this concern directly with the team member

explanation: Whenever there is an issue, you should address it as you are the project manager. In this case, there is an issue with the behavior of the team member, and the right thing to do is to bring up the issue directly with the team member.

question: You are working on a project when the customer calls to explain that he wants another feature added to the product. However, there is no additional budget for the new feature. What should you do?

options.B: Inform the customer that he must provide additional funds for the new feature
options.C: Follow the contract change control process
options.D: Remove some other feature and add the new feature

explanation: Whenever there is a change, the right process is to follow change control. It's quite possible that you can remove the old feature and add the new feature at the same cost, but it should be done following the change control process.

question: You are working on a large project where you have to identify various subcontractors to do certain parts of the project. One of your potential subcontractors, Susan, is not from the same city and you have called her for contract term negotiations at your office the next morning. However, the evening before the meeting, you find out that the part of work that needs to be subcontracted has been cancelled. What should you do in such a scenario?

options.B: Change face-to-face meeting to Telephonic Meeting
options.C: Ask your Subordinate to meet the Subcontractor
options.D: Meet the Subcontractor as you have already called her

explanation: It's not ethical to waste anyone's time when you know that the task that was supposed to be subcontracted has already been cancelled.

question: One of your subcontractors sends a costly New Year's gift to you. What should you do?

options.A: Accept the Gift as it's a new year gift
options.C: Inform your manager and accept the gift
options.D: Establish whether accepting such a gift is against your company's policy

explanation: The first step always is to identify what is right and what is wrong. If your company policy does not allow you to accept gifts, then do not accept it. If your company policy allows you to accept New Year's gifts, then accept it.

question: You are the Project Manager of a new portal development project. You want to integrate your portal with one of the online payment gateways, but you have been experiencing major issues in receiving payment. The remote support from the payment gateway company is not of much help. Your team suggests getting one of their engineers online so that you can speed up the work. However, this will increase the project costs, which have not been budgeted. According to your team, there is no other option at this stage. What should you do?

options.A: Motivate your team members to solve the problem and integrate with this payment gateway
options.B: Ask your senior management to help you make the decision
options.C: Create a change request to ask for an engineer from the payment gateway company and present this to the change control board for approval

explanation: If you look at the question, there is a problem in the project, and the project team has not been able to find a solution. In this case, the only option left is to create a change request and ask for additional money to get the problem fixed.

question: Which of the following is NOT a technique used in "Acquire Project Team" process?
explanation: The tools and techniques for the "Acquire resources" can be found on Page 328 of PMBOK® Guide - Sixth Edition.

question: Which of the following is a hygiene factor according to Hertzberg's Motivation Theory?

options.A: Good relationships with co-workers and managers

explanation: Understanding what motivates a team member is important because few people are motivated by just money or challenging assignments. Hertzberg found that the factors causing job satisfaction (and presumably motivation) were different from those causing job dissatisfaction. He developed the motivation hygiene theory to explain these results. He called the satisfiers motivators and the dissatisfiers hygiene factors. He used the term "hygiene" in the sense that they are considered maintenance factors that are necessary to avoid dissatisfaction but that by themselves do not provide satisfaction.

question: Alex is the Project Manager of a large machinery manufacturing project. During the execution phase of the project, the customer asks for a major change in the machine design. The change has a huge time and cost implication, but the customer says there is not enough funding for this change. As a Project Manager, what should Alex do?

options.A: Meet with the customer to understand why he is asking for the change
options.B: Ask the team members to implement the change without going to the change control board
options.C: Escalate the issue to senior management and seek guidance
options.D: Do nothing and let the work continue as usual

explanation: Option B will be ruled out. If you are making any change, the change control board should be involved. Option D is not a good option. It just involves postponing the problem. Escalating the issue is not a good option unless you have complete details. The best option is option A.

question: Which of the following is NOT an example of the cost of quality?

options.A: Training team members on effective ways to look for product defects
options.B: Reviewing all the product requirements to ensure that everything is developed
options.C: Assigning two team members to work on product development

explanation: All of the other options come under the cost of quality. If you are not sure about the meaning of cost of quality, please refer to Lesson 8 of Simplilearn PMP® Preparation Course.

question: Which of the following types of power is considered best when leading a team?
explanation: Expert power is the ideal type of power to lead a team. In order to find out more about the different types of power, please refer to Lesson 9 of Simplilearn PMP® Preparation Course.

question: One of the subcontractors on your team explains how he faked his PMI® certificate and got onto the project team. As a certified Project Manager, what should you do?

options.A: Advise him not to do this in future
options.B: Do nothing, as he is now a friend

explanation: As a certified Project Manager, you are expected to be ethical. Since forging a PMP® certification is unethical, you should immediately inform PMI® about it.

question: You are currently working on a web development project to develop a new user interface for a legacy mainframe banking application. You are under a time and material contract to develop a web-based interface for this application. You have finished the work 20 hours earlier than expected. This means the profit of your company will decrease. What should you do?

options.A: Bill the customer for the expected amount as this is allowed by the provisions of your contract
options.B: Tell the customer you'll be adding additional requirements to the project in order to meet profit estimates
options.C: Add activities to the project to increase the number of billable hours
options.D: Inform the customer that your project is complete

explanation: You should truthfully inform the customer that you have completed the project.

question: You are managing a construction project using a firm fixed price (FFP) contract. The contract is structured so that your company will be paid a fee of $85,000 to complete the work. There was a $15,000 overhead cost that your company had to cover. You're now three months into the project, and your costs have just exceeded $70,000. The project has now consumed the entire fee, and your company will now be forced to pay for all costs on the project from this point forward. What's the BEST way to describe this situation?

options.A: The project has ceased to be a profit center for the company
options.B: The Project Manager has overspent the budget
options.D: The project has reached the point of total assumption

explanation: The point of total assumption is the point at which the seller assumes the costs. In a firm fixed price contract, this is the point where the costs have become so large that the seller basically runs out of money from the contract and has to start paying the costs himself.

question: Joshua is the Project Manager of a new telecom project. Soon after the project started, he realized that his team has not estimated enough for R&D on the project. Joshua prepared a change request to add the extra work in the project scope statement and updated the project schedule to reflect the change. The change request was approved by the change control board. What should be his next step?

options.A: Start the work as it's approved by the Change Control Board
options.B: Update the Scope and Schedule baselines to reflect the approved changes
options.D: Perform Risk Identification to identify any Risk in the newly added work

explanation: Update the Scope and Schedule baselines to reflect the approved changes. Although the plan has been approved by the change control board, the first thing you should do is update the scope and schedule baseline.

question: One of your team members comes to you and proposes a change in the project that can reduce the project schedule by 3 months. As a Project Manager, what should you do?

options.A: Advise the team member to just focus on his work
options.B: Thank the team member and go ahead with the change
options.C: Analyze the impact of the change on the other triple constraints
options.D: Tell him that you cannot implement the change as the project deadline has already been communicated to the Customer

explanation: You should not go ahead and implement a suggestion just because the schedule is reduced by 3 months. The best thing to do in such scenarios is to analyze the impact on the other triple constraints. It's quite possible that the cost may increase.

question: When is the best time to do scope verification?

options.A: During administrative closure of the project
options.B: At the beginning of the project
options.C: At the end of each phase of the project
options.D: At the end of the project

explanation: If you think that option A could be the right answer, please note that you should verify the product scope at the end of the project.

question: Which of the following is a key objective of the Validate Scope process?

options.A: To ensure that the customer accepts the project deliverable
options.B: To track progress of requirement completion
options.C: To get better visibility on project progress

explanation: If you have got this question wrong, please read the Scope Management chapter for better understanding of what needs to be done in the Validate Scope process.

question: Which of the following is a technique of "controlling project scope"?
explanation: The other three options are techniques of "define scope."

question: If Earned Value (EV) is $550, Actual Cost is $650, and Planned Value is $600, what is the Cost Variance (CV)?
explanation: Apply the formula (CV=EV-AC) to get the answer. Though planned value is also provided in this question, it is not used in solving this problem. For more information on the earned value technique, please refer to Lesson 7 of Simplilearn PMP® Preparation Course.

question: The difference between a cost baseline and cost budget can be best described as:
explanation: For more information,  go through Lesson 7 of Simplilearn PMP Preparation Course.

question: A Cost Performance Index (CPI) of 0.73 means that:

options.A: The Project is only getting 73 cents out of every $1 spent
options.B: The Project would cost 37% more than originally planned
options.C: The Project is progressing at 73% of the rate originally planned
options.D: The Project would cost 73% more than originally planned

explanation: The Project is only getting 73 cents out of every $1 spent. For more information on the earned value technique, please refer to lesson 7 of Simplilearn PMP® Preparation Course.

question: A Schedule Performance Index (SPI) of 0.67 means that"

options.A: You are ahead of the Schedule by 33%
options.B: You are progressing at only 67% of the rate originally planned
options.C: You are progressing at only 37% of the rate originally planned
options.D: You are behind the schedule by 33%

explanation: For more information on the earned value technique, please refer to Lesson 7 of Simplilearn PMP® Preparation Course.

question: You are the Project Manager of a new road construction project with a total budget of $500,000.
